description: [Reuters] - Cash-strapped Centerra Gold Inc said on Friday that it will suspend its third-quarter and future dividends, citing financial restrictions by Kyrgyzstan on its key subsidiary, Kumtor Gold Co. The company, whose stock dropped as much as 7.15 percent to C$6.75 on the Toronto Stock Exchange in volatile Friday trading, said its board would reassess the decision after the issue with Kyrgyzstan is resolved. A Kyrgyzstan court ruling in June restricted Kumtor from making certain financial transactions, including the transfer of money to parent Centerra.
